text:
Hello I'm Eric Lanlard I'm a master pâtissier
or should I say a French master pâtissier

so I thought today as it's the season of entertaining
I'm going to share with you how to make the

perfect vol au vents with 3 delicious fillings
a chicken based one with mushroom and a lovely

creamy sauce, a seafood one slightly more
sophisticated with saffron and don't worry

if you are vegetarian I've got the perfect
option for you as well butternut squash roasted

with ras el hanout so a lot of middle eastern
flavours to it and some quinoa added to it

that recipe will make six individual vol au
vents it'll be perfect size for a starter

or if you're having a cocktail party and you
just want a little nibbles you can probably

make up to twelve mini versions of it we start
with the puff pastry of course you can make

your own which is absolutely perfect but it
does take time and it's quite a tricky part

to make I'm more than happy for myself or
yourself to buy shop bought puff pastry so

let's crack on with the recipe roll it like
so, so this is the perfect thickness 3 mm

time to cut our vol au vent so you will need
2 cutters one of that size and you need a

smaller one for the middles I'm gonna cut
my plain disc so I place them on my baking

tray so egg wash is basically just beaten
eggs that will give your vol au vents a lovely

glossy finish which will make them much more
appetising now ready for our second layer

so same cutter and I'm just gonna cut if you
need to roll some more pastry you have to

remember you can't use the trimming because
you will lose all those layers again and now

it's time to use our smaller cutter so I'm
just gonna cut the center off just gonna remove

this gently and place it on top here we are
my final one there are now ready to go into

the oven preheat it at 200 degrees Celsius
if you work on Fahrenheit that's 392 degrees

Fahrenheit they should take between 15-20
minutes when they are all puffed up when they

look glossy and yummy and golden time to pull
them out let's crack on with our filling the

first filling I'm gonna make is chicken and
mushroom I'm going to start in my warm pan

here to melt 30 grams of unsalted butter when
the butter is almost melted I'm going to add

one chopped onion I'm now adding three chicken
breasts chopped into cubes and I'm going to

cook them for around 6 minutes until they
are cooked right through next 70 grams of

chopped mushrooms and just for extra flavour
some fresh thyme and finally a glass of white

wine so now I'm just going to reduce the heat
keep it on a low heat and I'm gonna cook it

very gently for 10-12 minutes until the sauce
is completely reduced and the mushrooms are

perfectly cooked and after that I will be
making the traditional bechamel sauce I'm

going to melt 60 grams of unsalted butter
when the butter is melted I'm going to add

40 grams of plain flour so I've got the flour
and the butter together into my pan now and

I'm just going to cook them together until
I get a nice thick paste now I'm going to

add 480 mils of whole milk a little bit at
a time and for a boost of chicken flavour

I'm going to crumble into my sauce half a
cube of chicken stock now the rest of the

milk can go inside and here we are this is
ready this is your classic bechamel sauce

you can see its glossy it's smooth not a lump
in sight only one thing to do now is to gently

fold my chicken and all the sauces into the
bechamel sauce just for a touch of colour

and taste as well I've got some chopped parsley
here so this is ready to go looking fantastic

but let's get on now for recipe number 2 for
the seafood mixture so in my pan here which

is nice and warm I'm just going to melt 25
grams of unsalted butter I'm just going to

add to that 2 cloves of crushed garlic and
8 chopped mushrooms I'm just going to coat

all those lovely soft mushrooms and garlic
with a tablespoon of flour I've got 225 ml

of fish stock 110 mil of single cream and
I'm going to add to that a little secret ingredient

typical to the south of France half a glass
of Pernod that's gonna bring a lovely aniseed

flavour to our final sauce so 2 more ingredients
for a little bit of crunch I've got 1 leek

that has been finely chopped and one of my
favourite spices a good pinch of saffron so

it's time to add the star of the show the
seafood I decided to go for some large prawns

I've got some cod I've got some salmon and
just for a smokey flavour I've got some smoked

haddock as well I'm just going to add 450
grams of this seafood mixture to the sauce

and I'm just going to leave them to cook slowly
for 6-8 minutes on a gentle heat I'm just

going to add 1 tablespoon of chopped parsley
just to bring a bit of freshness to this rich

mixture well I have to say the seafood mixture
is smelling absolutely gorgeous so let's go

for filling number 3 the vegetarian option
now first of all I've chopped up 320 grams

of butternut squash into big chunks and I'm
just gonna roast it with a good splash of

olive oil sea salt I got some cumin seed in
here I'm just gonna give it a good sprinkle

so this is ready to go in my oven to roast
for roughly 15-20 minutes just check it out

with a knife we want them to be soft but at
the same time we want a little bit of bite

we want some texture into our vol au vents
when everything is put together the oven temperature

should be 200 degrees celsius I'm just going
to melt 25 grams of unsalted butter I'm just

going to add 250 grams of cooked and dry quinoa
and lentils to the butter and now I'm going

to cut my butternut squash into pieces to
combine all the ingredients together I added

500 grams of greek yoghurt but just to boost
that middle eastern theme I've got one of

my favourite spices from the middle east 2
tablespoons of ras el hanout which is a mixture

of paprika cumin cinnamon and rose petal and
finally for a touch of colour and flavour

I've got some fresh greek basil here using
siscors I'm just gonna chop it in, well time

to plate our vol au vent and I just warmed
them up a little bit more in a hot oven for

10 minutes so they're nice and hot but first
of all we need to trim the lid so you need

a very sharp knife you just use your knife
and gently cut a little lid which is in the

middle there just very carefully lift off
the the little lid keep it aside time to fill

our little beauties with the chicken one the
chicken is so succulent and the freshness

from the parsley coming through it just works
so well together the seafood for me this one

is my favourite I love the saffron really
giving that kind of like south of France tasting

and if you are vegetarian don't despair we've
got this special vegetarian filling here made

with roasted butternut squash with cumin and
some serious middle east va-va-voom all these

lovely hot spices coming through making it
so morish and here we are this is the ultimate

savoury and glamorous baking delicious thanks
Food Tube for having me on your channel and

sharing this delicious recipe with your viewers
and of course don't forget to subscribe to

my own channel if you love baking every Monday
it's a baking mad Monday!
